data.title: System.NullReferenceException at OpenRA.Exts.GetOrAdd
data.body:
Random in-game crash: exception.log:

```
Red Alert Mod at Version release-20141029
Operating System: Linux (Unix 3.16.0.4)
Runtime Version: Mono 3.2.8 (Debian 3.2.8+dfsg-9) CLR 4.0.30319.17020
Exception of type `System.NullReferenceException`: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
  at OpenRA.Exts.GetOrAdd[Type,ITraitContainer] (System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2 d, System.Type k, System.Func`2 createFn) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.TraitDictionary.InnerGet (System.Type t) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.TraitDictionary.InnerGet[ITickRender] () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.TraitDictionary.ActorsWithTrait[ITickRender] () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.World.ActorsWithTrait[ITickRender] () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.World.TickRender (OpenRA.Graphics.WorldRenderer wr) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game+<InnerLogicTick>c__AnonStorey0.<>m__1 () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Sync+<CheckSyncUnchanged>c__AnonStorey0.<>m__0 () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged[Boolean] (OpenRA.World world, System.Func`1 fn) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged (OpenRA.World world, System.Action fn) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick (OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Loop () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Run () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:
```

data.title: Avoid PowerShellisms to fix the AppVeyor build
data.body: as suggested in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7661#issuecomment-80761740

data.title: Support for using individual files for each frame of a sequence
data.body:
Example to explain what I mean:

Assume there are 64 single-frame shps (or GIFs or PNGs, once they're supported), let's say htnk01.shp - htnk64.shp -> treated by the engine like a single htnk.shp container.
bogus yaml code:
http://pastebin.com/SsFGjh4H

While this might be more costly performance-wise, it would make adding support for non-multi-frame formats easier (PNG probably being the most interesting option), and would also make life for modders easier because they could exchange individual frames more easily, quite convenient when your graphics are still work-in-progress.

data.title: Make gap generators work when shroud is disabled.
data.body:
Fixes #6123. This will look at game settings, if fog of war is disabled, gap gens will work like they do now. If fog of war is enabled, gap gens will generate fog and there won't be any frozen actors visible while they are operational. Also this commit disables auto targeting for units/structures under gap, even if you have satellite. So satellite icons will also not appear where gap gen is active.

I tested this and seems to work.

data.title: Implement Carryall edge spawn, harvester delivery by carryall and harvester insurance for D2k
data.body:
First off, this got a bit bigger than expected. So sorry, reviewers.

This is more or less a direct successor to #7300.

I spent quite a while organizing the changes into propper self-contained commits, so I strongly suggest reviewing, and even testing, by commits.
Despite the nice commit messages, I'm going to sum this up:
**1.** Make built carryalls spawn at the closest map edge cell instead of spawning at the High Tech facility
**2.** Do some refactoring to enable 3. and 4.
**3.** Enable FreeActors to be delivered from outside the map via transport (use case are the D2k harvesters, transported by carryalls; this might also be useful in some missions (TS?), but that's not important at the moment). This uses the closest map edge cell by default, but can be set to spawn at a specific location in the YAML file.
**4.** Add harvester insurance by attaching a new `HarvesterInsurance` trait to the player actor and making worms call that if they eat a harvester.

Side bonus: the shellmap got a bit more interesting due to the harvester's new harvesting location (the first time you watch it, at least :D ).

data.title: kennel placement is blocking dogs from spawning
data.body:
if you aren't careful while you are placing your kennel building you might end up placing it 1 cell north of another building or unwalkable terrain. The result is that your dogs can't get spawned in front of the kennel.

Suggestion: 
- make a 2 celled building, add a 1 cell bib infront the kennel

data.title: unable to repair silos that sit behind the refinery
data.body:
If you build a refinery in RA mod then build two silos behind the refinery. Upon the silo and refinery taking damage from a nuke, you are only able to repair the refinery and not the two silos.

Logic currently allows the user to build silos behind the refinery, however on mouseover or touch the refinery is selected rather than the silo.

Asset:
R = refinery
O = silo

ORO
RRR
RRR
RRR

Logic:
R = refinery
O = silo

RRR
RRR
RRR
RRR

Also replicated on mouse and keyboard. Occurs in stable, playtest and bleed.

data.title: Try to fix the AppVeyor build
data.body: Hopefully the last CI regression from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7510#issuecomment-80014679.

data.title: Buildings frozen under fog flicker
data.body: When an enemy building is discovered and after that its visibility is lost, the building's image flickers as it transitions from visible to frozen under fog.

data.title: A.I. uses SuperPowers with cheat-like precision
data.body:
In mod cnc, all A.I. use their super power weapons super effective, no matter if they are currently able to see the target or did ever discover this part of the map before. 
Got an Army of 25 Soldiers hidden and undiscovered in your base? Say goodbye to'em @ minute 4-7 of gameplay, thx 2 'luckshot' A.I. Airstrike. Same with IonCanon und Nuclear Missile.
Clearly recognizable it is, if you look at the replay and the view of the AI is activated.
Same's also if the a.i. attacks Harvesters with Helis but that's not a big problem...

so,
*\* If it's still in the complete black shroud, structures and soldiers should not be attackable by the a.i.
*\* If it's already discovered once, some randomness in aiming would be great, giving the exact aiming some 'errorness' correction. Example: getting a high random number let the A.I. miss it's main target and instead aim at something a little bit more south, west, north, whatever. A low random number let it hit the exact target it wants to hit.
*\* Units that the A.I. can't not be aware of, because it has no idea where they are, should somehow not be attackable. Instead the front of unit production buildings should be targeted, hoping that some units are still in place right there (like most human player would do).

Tanks for your attention, i hope something like this is usable and applicative somehow.

</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: [Proof-of-Concept] Improved the performance and intelligence of resource harvesting
data.body:
Improved the performance and intelligence of resource harvesting by refactoring the Harvesters' pathfinding. Now in first place they assess which is the closest resource inside their search area (previously it was quite "randomized" by the heuristic) and then a path is calculated. In fact, this change allowed me to get rid of the Harvester heuristic, which is great. This should improve performance as well.

I would appreciate help in testing that everything is in place, no regressions have appeared and any feedback you consider. This is a proof-of-concept and a work under development, so it would be cool if I require lot of input for it to improve performance and correctness.

data.title: Update year of Copyrights on Readme
data.body: Year of Copyrights on Readme updated to 2015.

data.title: Battle for Dune 3v3 map
data.body: PR as recommended by penev

data.title: Put game options in lobby under the map
data.body:
There is enough room to put the options under the map preview in lobby, if the chat area is reduced in width. Here's a crude mockup of how it could be done. A slight size adjustment may be needed but this would bring a noticable advantage I think.

![lobbysettings](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6599106/6630564/f24e5f38-c922-11e4-92a1-2fd5633fe2d9.png)

data.title: Fixed actors should lose target
data.body:
In issue https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/7567, actors would keep chasing the enemy even if it moved under the shroud. The target-line was also visible making it very easy to track the target. I changed the FlyAttack, HeliAttack and MoveAdjacent activity to check if the target moved under shroud, if so, the attack activity is cancelled and a regular move is issued to the last known location.

Would also fix:
    - https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/7584
    - https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/7498

data.title: Implement DeployToUpgrade.
data.body:
Will be useful once #7638 is merged.

**Uses**:
- RA2 GI
- TS Nod Artillery (and later GDI Juggernaut) assuming we don't transform them into structures in the same way vanilla TS did
- D2k Thumper

data.title: add /lib and /lib64 to the locations lookup for Lua
data.body: Fixes #7637

data.title: Tile glitch in D2k
data.body:
I was spamming the Grow Resources button when this little visual glitch happened:
![](http://i.imgur.com/7pt0CfJ.png)
The tiles were OK up until that point. I am guessing this is due to a wrong tile definition (transition tile defined as sand, so the spice was able to "grow" there and replace it), but I can't investigate that now.

data.title: Fix NRE caused by checking the RampType of a tile in #7645.
Enforce a line length limit.
data.body:
Prevent lines longer than 180 chars (tabs count as 4) via a SyleCopPlus rule.

It is open for discussion whether we want to enforce such a rule at all, and what values to use. I picked the current value as an arbitrary number to prevent crazy long lines but which didn't require me to fix a billion files.

data.title: Make EmitInfantryOnSell compare string[] for owner's race.
data.body:
`EmitInfantryOnSell` now checks a `string[] Races` against the selling player's race.

I also added EIOS to TS because it was missing.

Kinda off-topic:
This trait should be renamed to `EmitActorsOnSell` and..
We need this same logic for OnDestroyed/Death/whatever.

data.title: Replace flak truck with CC-licensed art
data.body:
This image is based on [@katzsmile's work](http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=83&p=288983&sid=7e9cd428fa9bcfa0e820cf8db2121289#288983), which in turn is based on [this CC-BY-SA-licensed image](http://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:BTR-40-latrun-2.jpg). I merely shortened the barrel somewhat, so thanks to @katzsmile for doing the grunt work!

![ftrkicon](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4331210/6604816/8ebb8e52-c82b-11e4-8030-8fb176db1a7c.png)

Fixes #7589.

data.body: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3696546/6604168/9b4da914-c81e-11e4-9bd7-d11304180346.png)

data.title: Mark ramp/slope tiles as unbuildable.
data.body: Works in RA2.

data.title: HackyAI can now build buildings near a new MCV
data.body:
There was an issue where HackyAI would try and fail to build buildings
at old base location, unless it was placed at the
same place where the old MCV was.

This makes AI more resilient to A-bomb attacks where Construction Yard is destroyed and it builds and deploys a new one.

data.title: (Turns out it's a feature) Boats get stuck in naval yard
data.body:
Here you can see me placing the naval yard next to the south edge but this happens close to shore as well.
![openra game_2015_03_11_12_37_39_035](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7798635/6595583/ea6e6232-c7eb-11e4-88d9-a005e66d0957.png)

data.title: Screenshot on Wikipedia and ModDB is horribly outdated
data.body:
The screenshot at http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Command_%26_Conquer:_Red_Alert and the header background at http://www.moddb.com/games/openra clearly show the old sidebar layout and one infantry per cell.  This means it is at least 4 years out of date.

It should be simple for someone with edit access to add a recent screenshot that at least includes the new RA sidebar.

data.title: Add a Cloaking sound to the Phase Transport
data.body: Adds a cloaking sound to the phase transport. This uses the same sound the Phase Transport used in the Single Player campaigns in Counterstrike.

data.title: SoundOnDamageTransition to use string[].
data.body: Requested by @bvandenbogaard.

data.title: Remove TurboBoost and various other Projectile cleanups
data.body:
Commits should be self-explanatory.

Note: All yaml changes except the RA StingerAA weapon have been produced by the provided upgrade rules, so they've been tested and work.
